decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
Reason:-

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The retail premises shall not be open other than between the hours of 7am - 11pm Monday to Sunday including Bank and Public Holidays without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-

To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Within three months of the date of this decision notice, a scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority which specifies the provisions to be made for the control of noise emanating from the site. Such scheme as may be approved shall be implemented and thereafter retained in accordance with such details.
Reason:-
To prevent noise nuisance to adjoining / adjacent properties.

No delivery activities shall take place anywhere on the proposed store except between the hours of 07:00 hours and 20:00 hours Monday - Saturday and 08:00 - 19:00 hours on Sundays and Bank and Public Holidays to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To prevent noise nuisance to neighbouring residential properties. To comply with Policy DC55 and DC61 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Planning Document.
The parking area at the front of the convenience store shall be limited to customers and deliveries and loading only and retained permanently for that use.
Reason:-

To ensure that there is sufficient parking for the customers visiting the convenience store and for deliveries and loading. To comply with Policy DC33 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Policy 6.13 of the London Plan.
The cycle storage shown on Drawing Number 111 REV A and dated 08.04.2019 shall be implemented and permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:-
To ensure a wide range of facilities for non-motor car residents and sustainability.

Within three months of the date of this decision notice the disabled parking bays shall be marked out in accordance with details shown on Drawing Number 111 REV A and dated 08.04.2019  . The disabled parking bays shall thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: - To ensure that there is sufficient disabled car parking bays within the development. To comply with Policy DC33 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Policy 6.13 of the London Plan.

Permitted development Rights are removed for a change of use from use class A1 to use class A3 (restaurant / cafe) under Part 3, Class C of the Town and Country Planning General Permitted Development Order or any equivalent provision.
Reason: -
In the interests of protecting the amenity of neighbouring residents. To comply with Policy DC61 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.

Within three months of the date of this decision notice, details of refuse and recycling facilities are to be provided in accordance with details which shall previously have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The refuse and recycling facilities shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:-

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge how refuse and recycling will be managed on site.  Submission of this detail prior to occupation in the case of new building works or prior to the use commencing in the case of changes of use will protect the amenity of occupiers of the development and also the locality generally and ensure that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
Trolley bays shall be in accordance with details shown on Drawing Number 111 REV A and dated 08.04.2019  .
Reason: -

To prevent trolleys obstructing the parking area and being left on the adjacent highway to the detriment of highway safety and the safety of users of the parking area. To comply with Policy DC33 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Policy 6.13 of the London Plan.

With three months of the date of this decision notice, specific details of plant and machinery, including any refrigeration equipment shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the local planning authority.
Reason: -
In the interests of protecting the amenity of neighbouring occupants and residents. To comply with Policy DC61 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD.
With three months of the date of this decision notice details of a strategy for the parking of delivery and loading vehicles shall be submitted to the local planning authority.
Reason: To ensure the safe and convenient use of the parking area.  To comply with Policy DC33 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Policy 6.13 of the London Plan.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraphs 186-187 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2012.

A fee is required when submitting details pursuant to the discharge of conditions.  In order to comply with the Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) Regulations 2012, (as amended), a fee of £116 per request or £34 where the related permission was for extending or altering a dwellinghouse, is needed.
